channel.title: What's New Now
channel.description: Keep up to date with what's new now in the world of technology, brought to you by PC Magazine analysts and producers.
channel.itunes:author: Sebastian Rupley
channel.itunes:subtitle: Keep up to date with what's new now in the world of technology, brought to you by PC Magazine analysts and producers. We focus on news analysis, product deconstruction and off-beat opinions on technology news and events.
channel.itunes:summary: Keep up to date with what's new now in the world of technology, brought to you by PC Magazine analysts and producers. We focus on news analysis, product deconstruction and off-beat opinions on technology news and events.

item.title: What's New Now 041: Lost in Space
item.description: Host: Brooks Rowlett. The Topics: Free Amazon Movies, Visa's Pay-by-Phone Plans May Be Doomed, Hubble Telescope Trouble, Internet Radio Bill Passes House, and more!
item.itunes:author: Ziff Davis Media
item.itunes:subtitle: Host: Brooks Rowlett. The Topics: Free Amazon Movies, Visa's Pay-by-Phone Plans May Be Doomed, Hubble Telescope Trouble, Internet Radio Bill Passes House, and more!

item.title: What's New Now 040: Android Lands
item.description: Host: Brooks Rowlett. The Topics: T-Mobile's Google Android-Based G1 is Unveiled, Amazon Enters Mobile Music Market, Verizon's Move to Month-to-Month, Dell Aims For First Time PC Buyers, Google Maps Goes Public...Transit, Microsoft Drops Seinfeld, Apple's Shocking Discovery

item.description: Host: Dan Evans. The Topics: T-Mobile's Google Android-Based Phone, SanDisk Rejects Samsung's $5.8 Billion Bid, Blackberry Pearl Flips Out, Palin's Yahoo Account Hacked, E-Waste Shipped Overseas, Microsoft Drops Seinfeld, New Canon EOS 5D tries to One-Up Nikon in Video.

item.title: What's New Now 028: YouTube Goes for the Gold!

item.title: What's New Now 025: Digg Dugg
item.description: Host: Nicole Price Fasig. The Topics: Microsoft exec who led Yahoo buyout team to leave. Knol, Google's Wikipedia Knockoff, goes public. Google to acquire Digg? Sony opens E-Book Reader to other booksellers. Hasbro Orders Facebook to Remove 'Scrabulous'.

channel.media:description: Keep up to date with what's new now in the world of technology, brought to you by PC Magazine analysts and producers. We focus on news analysis, product deconstruction and off-beat opinions on technology news and events.
